body: @Luni-4 So we have to implement the blank metric just like we dig in that repo of rust code analysis. can you guide me more on this ?? I would like to work on this issue
so can i work on both this one and #1448
@rajpratyush I told you, you can work on anything you want. Issues are not assigned until there is a PR linked to them :)

Hi @rajpratyush! Thanks for your help! :)

Yes, you can implement the two issues you have chosen in this way:
- One pull request for the `Blank` metric
- One pull request for the `Mi` metric

To get the data associated to those metrics from `rust-code-analysis`, use as reference the commit posted above by @marco-c
@marco-c  @Luni-4  @rajpratyush  If this is still available I would love to work on this.

issue.title: Add Blank Metric

issue.body:
Attempt to fix #1482. 

Please tell me if I've messed up somewhere.

body:
Hey, I had started a PR on this issue but a KeyError on a line is making the [bugbug tests](https://community-tc.services.mozilla.com/tasks/d2w90CyRRQug4835ZEPdKQ) fail.

Copy-pasting my message on the PR:

> 
> 
> The bugbug test logs [here](https://community-tc.services.mozilla.com/tasks/P6uOPVR_TK6cmNc7k_s9bg/runs/0/logs/public/logs/live.log) always show a KeyError when using the `metrics` dictonary.
> 
> [`obj["blank_total"] += metrics["blank"]["sum"]` on line 508](https://github.com/1Gokul/bugbug/blob/e10c6a654d91ef5cc02c9cef05e4f6e792193e8c/bugbug/repository.py#L508) seems to be causing the error.
> 
> Any ideas on how to fix?

I actually wasn't sure if I should've included the line. A KeyError means that the "blank_total_ key doesn't exist, right? So should I remove the line?
@1Gokul for issues about the PR, please comment in the PR itself.
